column1: If set to Yes, the tracking script will use the dedicated Rest API endpoint to send its data instead of using the legacy invisible pixel method. Useful if you have issues white-listing the tracker image URL with parameters in your frontend cache or if you customized the data collection and the tracker needs to send bigger payloads than usual.
column2: If set to Yes, the tracking script will use the dedicated Rest API endpoint to send its data instead of using the legacy invisible pixel method. Useful if you have issues white-listing the tracker image URL with parameters in your frontend cache or if you customized the data collection and the tracker needs to send bigger payloads than usual.

column1: We are so grateful you're using Elasticsuite on your webshop and we truly hope we've been part of your business growth since many years now.

column1: We'd like to invite you to extend your connection with Elasticsuite by subscribing to our newsletter. Stay ahead of the curve with exclusive insights into our cutting-edge product features. column1: There are %1 invalid Elasticsuite tracker events in the tracker events queue table. This could indicate that something is wrong with the Elasticsuite tracker tags in the frontend.
column2: There are %1 invalid Elasticsuite tracker events in the tracker events queue table. This could indicate that something is wrong with the Elasticsuite tracker tags in the frontend.

column1: Those invalid tracker events will not be indexed into your behavioral data indices and will automatically be deleted after %1 days.
column2: Those invalid tracker events will not be indexed into your behavioral data indices and will automatically be deleted after %1 days.

column1: You can decide to remove all of them immediately from the Elasticsuite tracker settings in the "Queue cleanup configuration" section.
column2: You can decide to remove all of them immediately from the Elasticsuite tracker settings in the "Queue cleanup configuration" section.

column1: Purge the queue of all invalid events now

column1: An error occurred while purging the tracker events queue.

column1: You can click this button to immediately remove all the invalid tracker events from the indexing queue, regardless of the Delay setting above.

column1: If enabled, it will prevent known IA or search engines crawler bots generated tracker hits from being recorded to prevent your behavioral data from being polluted by sometimes totally incoherent pagination or results count data.

column1: If you think the Elasticsuite Search Usage screen is lacking some behavioral data, make sure the "elasticsuite_index_log_event" cronjob is running regularly enough.
